entry.title: Jeff Circeo commented on SEM-1695 - Add a "Previous versions" tab to the report manager
entry.summary:
Philip Portnoy,

Possible script to show previous versions

declare @ReportId int = 197
 
 
 
SELECT 
	rv.Id, ReportId, rc.Name Category, cs.Name Connection,
Read more
entry.content:
Philip Portnoy,

Possible script to show previous versions

declare @ReportId int = 197
 
 
 
SELECT 
	rv.Id, ReportId, rc.Name Category, cs.Name Connection, rv.Name, rv.DisplayName, rv.Type, rv.[Order], rv.EnabledForAllUsers, rv.CreatedAt, rv.UpdatedAt
 
FROM
 
	s1inc_ReportVersions AS rv inner join
 
	s1inc_ReportCategories rc on rc.Id = rv.ReportCategoryId inner join
 
	s1inc_ConnectionStrings cs on rv.ConnectionStringId = cs.Id
 
where
 
	rv.ReportId = @ReportId
 
ORDER BY 
	UpdatedAt DESC

activity:target.title: SEM-1695
activity:target.summary: Add a "Previous versions" tab to the report manager

When the user clicks on the tab they will see a list of all previous versions with the

Read more
entry.content:
Please create a "Previous versions" tab next to the "Users" and "Xml Editor" tabs on the Report Manager page for each report. emsysqa.s1inc.com/ReportManager

When the user clicks on the tab they will see a list of all previous versions with the following columns

Revert button, Connection, Category, Name, DisplayName, Type, Order, EnabledForAllUsers, CreatedAt, UpdatedAt

I've attached a screenshot you that shows some of what I'm looking for but it doesn't include all the fields so make sure you add them as well.

entry.title: Jeff Circeo updated the Description of SEM-1695 - Add a "Previous versions" tab to the report manager
entry.summary:
Please create a "Previous versions" tab next to the "Users" and "Xml Editor" tabs on the Report Manager page for each report. emsysqa.s1inc.com/ReportManager

When the user clicks on the tab they will see a list of all previous version report names

Read more
entry.content:
Please create a "Previous versions" tab next to the "Users" and "Xml Editor" tabs on the Report Manager page for each report. emsysqa.s1inc.com/ReportManager

When the user clicks on the tab they will see a list of all previous version report names that have been used on the site. The names will be bulleted with blue arrows (the same blue arrows on the Report Manager) and when the user clicks to open the arrow it will show the entire code from the previous version.

On the right side of each report version name there should be a button called "Revert Report." Clicking on that button should revert the website back to that version of the report.
